title: Supply and Application of Interior and Exterior Paints for Commercial Complex
description: The Public Works Department of Maharashtra invites proposals for comprehensive painting services for a newly constructed 50,000 sq ft commercial complex in Mumbai. The scope includes supply and application of premium quality interior emulsion paints for office spaces, corridors, and common areas, as well as exterior weather-proof paints for the building facade. Additional requirements include protective coatings for metal fixtures and railings, surface preparation work including filling, sanding, and priming. The contractor must provide eco-friendly, low VOC (Volatile Organic Compounds) products that comply with environmental standards. A 5-year warranty on workmanship and paint durability is mandatory. The project must be completed within 90 days of contract award. Bidders should have prior experience in commercial building projects of similar scale and must provide samples and technical data sheets for all proposed products.

DLF Limited seeks premium quality painting solutions for their upcoming luxury residential project comprising 500 high-end apartments spread across 5 towers in Gurugram. The project requires top-tier interior emulsion paints in various color palettes for living rooms, bedrooms, and common areas, designer texture paints and special finishes for feature walls and accent areas, moisture-resistant paints for kitchens and bathrooms, and comprehensive external facade treatment including weather-proof coatings and waterproofing solutions. The total interior area is approximately 750,000 sq ft and external facade area is 200,000 sq ft. Apartments are categorized into 2BHK, 3BHK, and 4BHK units, each requiring customized color schemes as per approved interior design plans. Bidders should offer multiple premium brands and product lines, provide extensive color consultation services, ensure superior finish quality meeting luxury standards, and complete work as per phased handover schedule over 8 months. The external facade requires specialized weather-proof elastomeric coatings that can withstand harsh weather conditions, UV resistance, and maintain aesthetic appeal for minimum 10 years. All products must be eco-friendly with low VOC content. Experience in luxury residential projects mandatory.

title: Wood Stains, Varnish and Lacquer Supply for Furniture Manufacturing
description: Godrej Interio, one of India's leading furniture manufacturers, requires high-quality wood finishing products for their manufacturing facilities in Mumbai and surrounding areas. The annual requirement is approximately 50,000 liters across various product categories. Specific requirements include wood stains in multiple shades (walnut, mahogany, teak, oak, cherry, natural) in both water-based and solvent-based formulations, clear polyurethane varnish in gloss, semi-gloss, and matte finishes with excellent clarity and non-yellowing properties, nitrocellulose and polyurethane lacquers for spray application, wood sealers and primers for optimal surface preparation, and specialized products for different wood types (hardwood, softwood, engineered wood, MDF). All products must be fast-drying to optimize production cycles (touch dry within 2-4 hours), provide durable finish resistant to scratches, water, and heat, offer excellent flow and leveling properties for smooth application, and maintain color consistency across batches. Eco-friendly, low-VOC formulations are highly preferred to meet export market requirements and improve workplace safety. Bidders should provide comprehensive technical support including application training for workers, troubleshooting assistance, and color matching services. The contract period is for 2 years with monthly supply based on production schedules. Suppliers must have manufacturing capacity to ensure consistent supply and maintain buffer stock. Product samples and technical data sheets mandatory with bid submission.

title: Supply of Child-Safe Paints for 50 Government Schools
description: The Karnataka Department of Education invites bids for bulk procurement and application of child-safe, non-toxic paints for 50 government primary and secondary schools across Bengaluru district. The total coverage area is approximately 200,000 sq ft including classrooms, corridors, common areas, libraries, and administrative offices. All paints must be completely lead-free (zero lead content), formulated with low or zero VOC emissions, non-toxic and safe for children's health, washable and stain-resistant for easy maintenance, quick-drying with minimal odor, and certified to meet IS 13730 or equivalent international standards. Bright, vibrant colors are strongly preferred to create stimulating learning environments - including shades of yellow, blue, green, orange, and white. The scope includes surface preparation, minor wall repairs, application of primer and two coats of finish paint. Bidders must supply color charts and obtain approval from school principals before application. Work must be completed during summer vacation period (April-May 2026) to avoid disruption to classes. The supplier should provide detailed material composition certificates and safety data sheets. Experience in institutional painting projects and capacity to handle multiple sites simultaneously is essential. A 3-year warranty against peeling, fading, or defects is required.

title: Premium Decorative Texture Paint for Luxury Villa Project
description: Oberoi Realty is developing an ultra-luxury villa project 'Oberoi Garden City Villas' in Mumbai featuring 25 exclusive independent villas with cutting-edge architectural design and premium interior finishes. Each villa ranges from 4,500 to 8,000 sq ft with high ceilings, large walls, and contemporary design requiring exceptional decorative wall treatments. The requirement includes premium texture finishes such as Italian stucco, Venetian plaster, and suede effects for feature walls and living areas, metallic and pearl finish paints in gold, silver, bronze, and copper tones for accent walls and decorative elements, designer specialty coatings that create visual effects like stone texture, concrete finish, rustic wood look, and marble effect, silk and satin finish emulsions for bedroom walls creating luxurious sheen, and customized color palettes developed in consultation with renowned interior designers. The total coverage area for all 25 villas is approximately 60,000 sq ft of decorative wall treatments. High-end imported products from European or American brands are acceptable and preferred for specific applications. All finishes must be durable, washable, and maintain their aesthetic appeal over time. The contractor should have in-house specialized artisans trained in applying various decorative techniques, provide extensive portfolio of completed luxury projects, offer customization and mock-up preparation before final application, and work closely with interior designers throughout the project. Each villa will have unique finish combinations requiring flexibility and creativity. The project timeline is 10 months with phased completion of 5 villas every 2 months. Quality and aesthetics take precedence over cost. Experience in ultra-luxury residential or hospitality projects with similar scope is mandatory. Detailed material specifications, application techniques, and maintenance guidelines must be provided.

title: Interior and Exterior Painting Contract for New Airport Terminal
description: Airports Authority of India invites comprehensive painting proposals for the newly constructed international terminal at Rajiv Gandhi International Airport, Hyderabad. This prestigious project covers approximately 150,000 sq ft of interior and exterior surfaces requiring specialized aviation-grade finishes. Interior scope includes passenger arrival and departure halls with high ceilings (15,000 sq ft), retail and duty-free shopping areas (20,000 sq ft), immigration and customs zones (10,000 sq ft), baggage claim areas (12,000 sq ft), VIP lounges and business class facilities (8,000 sq ft), administrative offices and airline counters (15,000 sq ft), and corridors, staircases, and service areas (70,000 sq ft). Exterior scope covers terminal facade with glass and metal cladding interface (40,000 sq ft) and service buildings and annexes (15,000 sq ft). Critical requirements include fire-retardant paints meeting BS 476 Part 7 Class 1 or equivalent for all public areas, high-traffic durable coatings for flooring demarcation and wall protection, anti-static paints for sensitive electronic equipment areas, acoustic paints where noise reduction is required, weather-resistant exterior coatings capable of withstanding extreme temperatures and monsoon conditions, and aesthetic premium finishes creating a world-class ambience with approved color schemes. All work must comply with DGCA regulations and international aviation safety standards. The contractor must have experience in airport or similar high-security infrastructure projects, coordinate with multiple concurrent contractors on site, work in shifts to maintain construction schedule, complete project within 6 months, and provide 5-year comprehensive warranty. Security clearance for all workers is mandatory.

title: Anti-bacterial Paint and Wall Coating Services for Multi-Specialty Hospital
description: Apollo Hospitals Delhi requires specialized anti-bacterial and anti-fungal paint solutions for comprehensive interior wall treatment covering approximately 80,000 sq ft across multiple floors and departments. The project encompasses critical areas including 4 operation theaters, 100 patient rooms, ICU units, corridors, waiting areas, and administrative spaces. All products must meet stringent healthcare standards and possess certifications for hospital use. The paints must be resistant to frequent cleaning with hospital-grade disinfectants and chemical agents, provide a smooth non-porous surface that prevents microbial growth, and be easy to maintain. Special attention required for OT areas with specific color requirements (typically light green or blue) and enhanced anti-microbial properties. The successful bidder must be a certified installer with experience in healthcare facilities, provide material safety data sheets, ensure zero disruption to hospital operations during application, and complete work in phases. A 7-year performance warranty is mandatory. Products should be low-odor or odorless and quick-drying to minimize patient discomfort.

title: Complete Painting and Wall Finishing for 5-Star Hotel Renovation
buyer_name: The Leela Palaces, Hotels and Resorts
description: The Leela Palace Udaipur, an iconic luxury heritage hotel, is undergoing comprehensive renovation and seeks specialized painting and decorative finishing contractors. This prestigious project demands the highest standards of craftsmanship and aesthetics befitting a 5-star luxury property. The extensive scope covers 200 guest rooms and suites including bedrooms (luxury emulsions in designer color palettes), bathrooms (moisture and mildew-resistant paints suitable for high-humidity areas), wardrobes and furniture touch-ups (wood stains and protective coatings), and balconies (weather-resistant exterior paints). Public areas and common spaces include grand lobby and reception area with high ceilings requiring premium finishes and possible decorative elements, 3 specialty restaurants with distinct themes requiring customized color schemes and textures, 2 banquet halls (8,000 sq ft total) for weddings and events with elegant finishes, spa and wellness center requiring calming, soothing colors with anti-bacterial properties, swimming pool deck and surrounding areas with waterproof and anti-skid coatings, corridors and circulation areas with durable high-traffic paints, and back-of-house areas including staff areas and service corridors. Special finishes and effects include wallpaper-like decorative finishes eliminating need for actual wallpaper in select areas, metallic and pearl effects for feature walls, textured finishes for visual interest, and gold or silver leafing work for heritage architectural details. All products must be absolutely odor-free or very low-odor as the hotel will remain partially operational during renovation, quick-drying to minimize room downtime and maximize availability, premium quality from top-tier brands ensuring longevity and luxury appearance, and eco-friendly with certifications for guest health and safety. The project must be executed in carefully planned phases to ensure minimal disruption to hotel operations, with rooms completed in batches of 20 over 4 months. Work timing will be primarily during off-peak hours and checkout periods. The contractor must have extensive experience in luxury hospitality projects with 5-star hotels or heritage properties, provide a dedicated project manager and supervision team on-site full-time, coordinate with interior designers, architects, and hotel management, maintain strict security and confidentiality, and provide 3-year warranty on all work. Portfolio submission with similar high-end hotel projects is mandatory. This is a time-sensitive project requiring efficient execution without compromising quality.

title: Anti-Corrosive Coating for Steel Bridge Infrastructure
description: National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) seeks specialized contractors for heavy-duty anti-corrosive protective coating of the Hooghly River steel bridge structures near Kolkata. This critical infrastructure maintenance project covers approximately 30,000 square meters of steel surface area including main girders, cross-beams, trusses, deck supports, and ancillary steel structures. The bridge is located in a challenging coastal environment with high humidity, salt-laden atmosphere, and industrial pollution, requiring superior corrosion protection systems. The comprehensive scope includes complete removal of existing failed coatings, rust, and mill scale using ultra-high pressure water jetting or abrasive blasting to achieve SA 2.5 cleanliness standard as per ISO 8501-1, application of inorganic zinc-rich epoxy primer (minimum 75 microns DFT) for galvanic protection, epoxy intermediate coat (150-200 microns DFT) for enhanced barrier protection and surface build-up, and polyurethane or acrylic polyurethane topcoat (75-100 microns DFT) with excellent UV resistance and color retention. Total dry film thickness should be minimum 300 microns. The coating system must be certified for C5-M marine/industrial environment as per ISO 12944, achieve minimum 15-year service life without major maintenance, withstand temperature variations from 5°C to 50°C, resist salt spray test for 3000 hours (ASTM B117), and maintain adhesion after immersion and humidity testing. Work must be executed during favorable weather conditions with strict quality control including DFT measurements, adhesion tests, and holiday detection at 100% coverage. All workers must be NACE Level 2 certified coating inspectors supervised by NACE Level 3 inspector. Traffic disruption should be minimized by working in phases. Contractor must have successfully completed similar bridge coating projects of minimum 20,000 sq meters in the last 5 years. Comprehensive safety plan for working at heights and over water is mandatory.

title: Protective Coating for Chemical Storage Tanks and Pipeline Infrastructure
description: Reliance Industries Limited, Jamnagar Refinery Complex, requires high-performance industrial protective coating systems for critical infrastructure assets. The project scope encompasses 25 large-capacity chemical storage tanks (ranging from 50,000 to 200,000 liters each) and approximately 5 kilometers of above-ground pipeline infrastructure. The coating system must provide comprehensive protection against highly corrosive chemicals including acids, alkalis, and petroleum products, withstand operating temperatures ranging from -20°C to 150°C, resist UV degradation and weathering in harsh coastal-industrial environment, and prevent electrochemical corrosion. The work includes complete surface preparation using grit blasting to SA 2.5 standard, application of zinc-rich epoxy primer (minimum 75 microns DFT), intermediate epoxy coating (150-200 microns DFT), and polyurethane or fluoropolymer topcoat (75-100 microns DFT). All applicators must hold ISO 9001, ISO 14001, and NACE certification. The coating system must achieve a minimum 15-year service life. Detailed surface preparation and application procedures, quality control measures, and inspection protocols must be submitted. Work to be completed during scheduled plant shutdown periods to minimize operational disruption.

title: Terrace and External Wall Waterproofing for Residential Towers
description: Prestige Estates Projects invites proposals for comprehensive waterproofing solutions for their premium residential project 'Prestige Lakeside Habitat' consisting of 8 residential towers (G+15 floors each) in Bengaluru. The extensive scope covers terrace waterproofing for all 8 towers totaling 40,000 sq ft of exposed terrace area including proper slope correction, treatment of cracks and joints, application of polymer-modified cementitious waterproofing systems or liquid membrane systems, and heat-reflective coating on top surface to reduce heat absorption and lower cooling costs. External wall treatment includes dampness diagnosis and treatment for existing seepage issues, crack filling and surface preparation, application of water-repellent coatings that allow breathability while preventing water ingress, and treatment of window and door perimeters to prevent leakage. Basement waterproofing covers negative side waterproofing for basement walls (approximately 15,000 sq ft), treatment of floor slabs and sumps, and installation of drainage channels if required. Expansion joint sealing includes inspection and re-sealing of all expansion joints in buildings using flexible polyurethane or polysulfide sealants. The selected contractor must use ISI certified materials, provide 10-year comprehensive warranty against water seepage backed by insurance, conduct thorough pre-work inspection and submit detailed reports with photographs, work in phases to minimize inconvenience to residents, and complete entire project within 4 months. Heat-reflective terrace coating should reduce surface temperature by minimum 15-20 degrees Celsius. Post-work water testing and certification mandatory. Experience in large residential complexes with minimum 500 apartments is essential.

title: Design, Supply and Installation of Rooftop Solar Power Plant
description: Tata Motors Limited invites proposals for turnkey design, engineering, supply, installation, testing, and commissioning of grid-connected rooftop solar photovoltaic power plants with an aggregate capacity of 1.5 MW DC across their manufacturing facilities in Pune. The project aims to reduce carbon footprint and achieve renewable energy targets while generating cost savings on electricity bills. The scope encompasses detailed site survey and shadow analysis for 5 factory rooftops, structural assessment and load calculations to ensure roof integrity, design and engineering of complete solar PV system, supply of high-efficiency monocrystalline or polycrystalline solar modules (minimum 21% efficiency) from Tier-1 manufacturers, string inverters or central inverters from reputed brands with minimum 98% efficiency, module mounting structures - hot-dip galvanized steel or aluminum compatible with various roof types, AC and DC cabling, junction boxes, earthing, and lightning protection, remote monitoring system with real-time generation data and alerts, net metering arrangement and grid synchronization as per utility norms, and complete installation, testing, and commissioning. All equipment must be MNRE approved and carry relevant certifications (IEC, BIS). The solar modules should come with 25-year performance warranty (minimum 80% efficiency at year 25) and 10-year product warranty. Inverters should have 5-year standard warranty extendable to 10 years. The EPC contractor must provide comprehensive O&M services for 5 years including module cleaning, preventive maintenance, breakdown maintenance, and performance monitoring. The system should achieve grid connectivity within 6 months of contract award. Expected annual generation should be clearly mentioned with performance guarantees. Contractor must have completed minimum 5 MW of rooftop solar projects and have an in-house team of qualified electrical engineers and certified solar installers. Financial strength and adequate manpower mobilization capability are essential.

title: Procurement of Advanced MRI and CT Scan Machines
description: All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS), New Delhi, seeks to procure state-of-the-art medical imaging equipment to upgrade its radiology department and enhance diagnostic capabilities. The requirement includes one 3 Tesla MRI (Magnetic Resonance Imaging) machine with advanced imaging protocols for neurological, musculoskeletal, and cardiac imaging, and one 128-slice CT (Computed Tomography) scanner with dual energy imaging and cardiac capabilities. Both machines must be from reputed international manufacturers with FDA approval and CE certification. The scope includes complete equipment supply, site preparation and civil work requirements, installation and commissioning, comprehensive training for radiologists and technicians (minimum 5 days on-site), and a 5-year comprehensive annual maintenance contract with guaranteed uptime of 95%. The equipment should have the latest software with regular updates included, dose optimization features for patient safety, and DICOM compatibility with existing hospital PACS system. Bidders must provide detailed technical specifications, installation timelines (maximum 6 months from order), and references from at least 3 major hospitals in India where similar equipment is installed. The machines should come with a comprehensive warranty covering all parts and labor. On-site spare parts inventory and 24/7 service support are mandatory requirements.

title: Corporate Cafeteria and Catering Services
description: Infosys Limited, Bengaluru campus, requires a professional catering service provider to manage and operate the employee cafeteria serving over 3,000 employees daily across three shifts. The comprehensive scope includes breakfast service (7:00 AM - 10:00 AM) for approximately 800 employees, lunch service (12:00 PM - 2:30 PM) for approximately 2,500 employees with multiple cuisine stations, dinner service (7:00 PM - 9:00 PM) for approximately 500 employees, snacks and beverages available throughout working hours (6:00 AM - 10:00 PM), and special catering for meetings, conferences, and corporate events. Menu requirements include North Indian, South Indian, Continental, and Chinese cuisine options, dedicated vegetarian and non-vegetarian counters, healthy food options including salads, grilled items, and low-calorie meals, and specialized dietary accommodations (Jain food, vegan options, gluten-free items). The service provider must maintain stringent hygiene standards with valid FSSAI license and regular health inspections, employ trained and certified kitchen staff with food handler certifications, use quality ingredients from approved vendors with full traceability, implement waste management and sustainability practices, maintain kitchen equipment and dining furniture, and provide real-time feedback mechanism for employees. The cafeteria infrastructure, including kitchen equipment and dining area, will be provided by Infosys. The contract is for 3 years with annual renewal based on performance. Competitive meal pricing with subsidized rates for employees is expected. Bidders must have experience in managing corporate cafeterias serving 2,000+ people daily.
